This game is fun. I even preordered it, but deleted it and decided I will come back later. It has evolved a lot, but there is just too much pay to win. I am in the early stage, silver 5, on world 3. But even with the amount of prizes you get in completing the adventure mode, these will become increasingly less valuable as you continue to play. Most of the fun that comes with this game is it’s multiple characters, which you have to pay for. You can also pay to get weapons that deal up to 30,000 damage per hit, or entire ultimate sets which in the early game, is impossible to beat, because of how the pvp works. It’s the same thing as pve. You slash, but not much dodging. So most fights just come down to who can jump on the other first, or who has the shorter cooldown. I do like the game at my stage so far, but I do see how this game will inevitably hit a wall. Players will stop, because it’s mindless spamming for pvp. Unless you guys somehow manage to pull through with adding more or changing pve, this game, as I’ve said before, will hit a wall. You have already exhausted most of what you can put in mid game and early game for pvp, so now you have to add things to only late game players for pvp. Though, there is a sliver of hope through overhauling or additions to pve. Along with the fact that people will get bored of playing the same character.

title.label: The games okay but the pvp is trash

content.label: The levels in the game are okay and it’s satisfying to clear each of them but in pvp mode you rarely get players that are actually around your level. I was playing as Quinn and had around 15k power but all the matches I got in the gold league were players that dropped money on the game and were broken as hell. It would’ve been fair if they added a bunch of bots in every power level so that it’s not utterly impossible to make it up the league

title.label: One of the best mobile games ever.

content.label:
Every single level based mobile game gets impossible to progress through after a while, the only option being paying. This game is totally different, i completed the campaign easily, it didnt require a certain amount of stars to get to the next stage, which would make you have to replay the other levels. Although it does reward you for getting all the stars in a level, theyre not required to progress the game, which made the game not feel like a chore, but an actual game.

You can earn everything in this game without paying, even though you can pay for them. I never felt that i was enjoying the game less because i couldnt pay for an item.

The loot system is very well thought out and balanced, and so is the skill upgrading, where you can create an offensive or defensive character, or maybe a balanced build.

The most important part is the gameplay. And i thought it was very fun, i think it was very smart to have mechanics such as the dash so that the game is not just spam attack to win. But i think that the skill gap could be increased more, at least in the arena mode. A lower level player can definitely defeat a higher level one, but it is definitely difficult, so i think that you should somehow increase the skill gap where good players win at least more often against worse players.

There were also no ads, unless you choose to watch one to get a specific item, but i never felt like i had to watch ads all day to upgrade my charcter.

Theres 3 (i believe) characters that you can pay for, their models are different and they have different skills. First i thought you could only pay for them, but when i leveled up with my character i realized that they were unlocked. When you unlock them they are level 1, so it doesnt mean that they are more powerful than the first character.

I dont know wether or not these character differ in power, or id theyre simply different, and have unique abilities. Im not entirely sure, but im playing with the 3rd character, and it doesnt seem that its more powerful than the first one, just different, sorta like games like overwatch, tf2 etc.

I was really surprised by this game because i thought it would be another ad riddled, freemium, hard to progress game that would feel like a chore, but its quite fun.
I love the game. But there’s 1 present blood. But still it’s a great game

I initially downloaded this game off a facebook add thinking it looked too good to be true. The intro was a bit confusing, but needless to say i stayed up for 4 hours playing it the first night. Every game has teo currencies, one an easy to get one for normal day to day purchases and another hard to get one that most games make you pay money for. This game doesnt do that, theres an amazing balance of grinding but not needing to grind too much to be able to get both forms of currency. Yes therr are random “loot box” type stuff but its not one size fits all. You can garuntee a weapon, or armor, or etc the only chance part is the rarity and theyre not too expensive for the in game currency. The characters are awesome, the pets and costumes are well designed and the level of variety is great. All around this is an amazing game and id like to see it expand alot in the future
As long as updates come

title.label: Very promising...but algorithm and updates messed it up

content.label:
This game seemed promising and is very enjoyable. However, some of the potential upgrades are not guaranteed. I don’t mind spending some $ to support the developers and have bought crystals to trade for weapons card, but kept getting lower grade weapons. Also used an ore to add more  sockets, but instead it removed the one I had. It’s frustrating when you spend $ to improve equipment, it gives you stuff that is weaker than what you have. I could have easily given this 5 stars, but equipment upgrade is very deceiving.

Updated Review:
The PvP is whack...don’t know what algorithm they are using. The program was putting the damage on my character for the hits I was dealing on the AI. If this continues, I will be deleting the game.

More review:
Developers definitely rigged the PvP’a AI difficulty to force you into spending more money just to keep up with gameplay.
I had a level 52 character with 62K survivability, and lost badly to a level 45 opponent with a 34K survivability. In addition, it is so obvious in the gameplay...especially when my character had 450 mobility, and yet my AI opponent who had 400 mobility was still moving faster than me. Especially executing special moves.

Update:
Developer responded, stating to leave any recommendations. My whole post was addressing concerns and issues. Clearly you guys don’t read the reviews.

This would be a far better experience if it were game-controller compatible. I use the Rotor Riot and would far prefer to use the controller over screen controls. Otherwise a fabulous game~

I’ve been playing this game for a week or so, and I really enjoy the campaign and all of the unique enemies. I love the challenge raids and the challenge tower, but the duel arena may be the most broken mode ever. Regularly, you will either encounter a hacker that has riddled with their hitbox to make it impossible to hit them, or you will encounter a pay-to-play player who easily kills you and downranks you. Either that, or unresponsive controls will doom you to being stuck at silver 5. The PvP mode could be changed to match players based on attack and health stats as opposed to randomly matching stronger players with weaker players.

Edit: The PvP has proven itself to be literal trash. I don’t know who has responsible for the op bots/ pay to win player matchmaker but they should be fired. The complete and utter lack of planning is clear.
Edit: Again, I cannot stress enough the lack of competency in the PvP game design. Having reached Bronze 1 and feeling very proud, I proceeded to lose to a series of higher level players that had power/attack levels and overall levels that completely outmatched my own. I’ve upgraded my gear as much as I can, and I still lose. I came back to this game with high hopes, and am leaving disgusted by the games lack of planning for PvP
Definitely worth the download
